result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross R Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order for release of property

Case called at 10:37am [mo]
Defendant Ross R Weber in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Hall submit Victim Impact Statement

On Count #5, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment within the next 90 days and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--the Defendant shall undergo Certified Batterer's Treatment and/or Anger Management, if directed by Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession/ consumption of any alcohol or non prescribed controlled substances
--no possession of any dangerous weapons, which includes firearms
--no acts of violence towards anyone or threats of violence
--contact with Amberlee Harvey as approved by Department of Corrections
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Upon questioning of the Court, Atty. Witt indicates that the weapon has been seized and requests the weapon be released to him(Atty. Witt) under the lien, instead of destroyed
--The State remains silent
The Court reviews statute 968.20
The Court will sign Atty. Witt's proposed order for release of property
---The Court signed 2 originals, one was returned to Atty. Witt
Days credit for time already served:  2  days

recess: 11:05am
Status conference on June 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 9:35am
Defendant Ross R Weber in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Witt indicates he would like another  opportunity to have a Pretrial Conference with the proseutor, ADA Beck; this is because ADA Beck has received some additional information that she wanted time to review before extending an offer. 
The Court continues the Bond. 
recess 9:37am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/13/15 at 11:00am (2) Status Conference on 6/11/15 at 10:30am.

The Court orders the bond be amended to allow alcohol monitoring to be done by a Remote Breath monitor available thru WCS that can  be left in his vehicle during work hours and utilized to test him on schedled breaks. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect as previously ordered.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:31 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Ross R Weber appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Weber will be retaining counsel; appear for bond purposes only

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Amberlee Harvey; may return to Lucille residence one time this week in presence of law enforcement to obtain personal belongings
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No possession of firearms
-Booking at JCSD
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on .  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.
Recess: 1:37 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference 4/8/15 at 11:00 am  - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 5/1/15 at 9:30 am - Send notices
